section.name: Setup
section.p:
To setup your development environment follow these steps:
Install a Java JDK in version 1.5 or higher. Open a shell and type the following command to verify your installation:
java -version
Install maven. Open a shell and type the following command to verify your installation:
mvn -version
Install subversion. It is recommended to install the native commandline client tool. If you are using Windows you might want to use tortoiseSVN instead or additionally. If you installed the commandline client, open a shell and type the following command to verify your installation:
svn --version
Check out the source-repository with your subversion client. With tortoiseSVN go to the folder where you want to checkout in your Windows-Exporer, perform a right-click and choose "Tortoise SVN > checkout". With the commandline client go to the directory where you want to checkout and type:
svn co https://m-m-m.googlecode.com/svn/trunk mmm
Install eclipse on your system. You can use an IDE of your choice instead but eclipse is the only IDE supported in this manual. Start eclipse (it is suggested to use the default for your workspace, you can start eclipse with "-data some/other/workspace" if you need another eclipse setup). Create a directory "eclipse-plugins" that is writeable for the account you are using (e.g. somewhere in your home directory). In the eclipse workbench select "Help > Software updates > Find and Install...". In the dialog click the button "New Remote Site..." and enter "Subclipse" as Name and "http://subclipse.tigris.org/update_1.0.x" as URL. Now click on "Finish", then check the subclipse plugin and proceed the installation BUT before pressing "Finish" in the last dialog (after license agreement) click on "Change Location" and select your created "eclipse-plugins" directory. Then finish the installation.
You may also install the m2eclipse plugin if you like (current version 0.0.9 is NOT recommended).
Open a shell and go to the directory where you checked out the repository and call the following command:
setup
Open a shell, go to the directory where you checked out the repository and call the following command:
mvn install
Be aware that on the first call maven will download "half of the internet" into your local repository. This will take quite a while. Further calls will be reasonable fast.
In your locally checked out repository invoke the setup-all script in the folder mmm-setup/scripts/<my-os>.
